title: Tom Parry (economist)
text:
Thomas Gregory Parry is an Australian <a href="economist">economist</a> and <a href="public%20servant">public servant</a> from <a href="Sydney">Sydney</a>.
Parry served as foundation chairman of the <a href="Independent%20Pricing%20and%20Regulatory%20Tribunal%20of%20New%20South%20Wales">Independent Pricing and Regulatory Tribunal of New South Wales</a> (IPART) for the 12 years to 2004.
Career.
Parry was Foundation NSW Natural Resources Commissioner, an Associate Commissioner of the <a href="Australian%20Competition%20and%20Consumer%20Commission">Australian Competition and Consumer Commission</a>, a Director of South East Sydney Area Health Board, a Director of the <a href="Children%27s%20Medical%20Research%20Institute">Children's Medical Research Institute</a>, a Director of the NSW Clinical Excellence Commission, and a member of the NSW Council on the Cost and Quality of Government. He has been an adjunct professor at the <a href="University%20of%20New%20South%20Wales">University of New South Wales</a> and a former Dean of the Faculty of Commerce at the <a href="University%20of%20Wollongong">University of Wollongong</a>.
In 2002 and 2003, he conducted the Ministerial inquiry into sustainable public transport in New South Wales. The inquiry's final report informs a significant amount of transport policy in New South Wales, including the corporatisation of <a href="Sydney%20Ferries">Sydney Ferries</a>, the reform of <a href="CountryLink">CountryLink</a>, and reforms to the fare structure.
After leaving <a href="Independent%20Pricing%20and%20Regulatory%20Tribunal%20of%20New%20South%20Wales">Independent Pricing and Regulatory Tribunal</a> in 2004, Parry joined <a href="Macquarie%20Bank">Macquarie Bank</a> to head up a new Community Partnerships Funds Management business. He moved to the Investment Banking Group in Macquarie in 2005 where he was Principal Adviser, Regulatory involved with <a href="Macquarie%20Group">Macquarie Group</a> interests globally in regulated utilities and infrastructure. He retired from Macquarie Group at the end of 2009.
Parry serves as chairman of <a href="First%20State%20Super">First State Super</a>, Chairman of the <a href="Australian%20Energy%20Market%20Operator">Australian Energy Market Operator</a> (AEMO), and is a director of <a href="Australian%20Securities%20Exchange">Australian Stock Exchange</a> Compliance Ltd, Powerco, New Zealand, Brisbane Airport Corporation, and a member of the <a href="Sydney%20Opera%20House%20Trust">Sydney Opera House Trust</a>.
Honours.
On 26 January 2006, Parry was appointed a Member of the <a href="Order%20of%20Australia">Order of Australia</a> for "service to public administration in New South Wales, particularly through the provision of advice to government on a range of economic regulatory, business promotion and industry issues."
